bibl.title: Letter from J.A. LePrince to Henry Rose Carter, June 14, 1923

div1.p: LePrince writes about organizing county interest in malaria control and sends a health department report.

div1.head: Letter from J.A. LePrince to Henry Rose Carter, June 14, 1923
div1.opener:
THE COMMITTEE ON ENGINEERING
OF THE
NATIONAL MALARIA COMMITTEE
HEADQUARTERS ROOM 17 COURTHOUSE
MEMPHIS, TENN.,
June 14/23
LePrince
J. A. LEPRINCE, CHAIRMAN
S. H. McCRORY
L. L. HIDINGER
H. W. VAN HOVENBERG
Dear Dr Carter
div1.p:
Among other things Ive been experi-
menting recently with organizing county
interest in malaria control just as they
have it in New Jersey less the tax item

That I prefer for them to discover for
themselves when the time for it is ripe-

Tahett writes me he has most of the
towns on the harder between Laredo &
Brownsville busy doing stegomyia control
work- His address is 321 Mills Building, El Paso, Tex.

In Shelby Co, Tenn we have each malaria
town (village) forming its own local anti malaria
assn, & they send representatives to the monthly
meetings of the Shelby County Malaria Control
Assn- With best wishes to you & Miss Laura
